185524648.review:
It runs well, easy to use with mouse, nice colour customisation. The real gem is that it has workshop support and there is like 39k puzzles on there. The quality of the workshop puzzles is hit or miss, though the vote system helps a bit there I guess. 1 downside of the workshop is that there's no way to sort out the puzzles you've already done which is annoying when there is so many.

It's free and there's no in-game/micro-transaction purchases or ads either. Want to play picross? Ta-da this'll do nicely. Don't expect more than just picross though.

185075992.review:
It's a pretty good Picross game if you're looking for just more Picross/Nonograms, but don't expect the level of quality of other Picross games, this game is as basic as it gets.

I have run into a few levels now however that I can't complete just by using the traditional techniques, and need to resort to guessing as I don't have enough information. I don't think these levels have enough info to solve them without guessing or brute force or something. 

My one suggestion to the developer would be to add some kind of "?" tool using middle click. This way I can mark spaces that "could" be with an alternate color/shape that way I can more easily see where I have information that may help if I'm just missing something. 

Overall a solid Picross game if you just want a nonogram game with a ton of levels but with some levels just being not well designed. 5/10

184719931.review: A fun game with your into this time of puzzle and what makes it better is the the steam workplace you don't need to download any puzzles you can play on the go and play kinda forever since people are uploading daily.
